svcproc.title: DISASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Normally the cranking motor should be disassembled only so far as is necessary to make repair or to replace defective parts. As a precaution, it is suggested that safety glasses be worn when disassembling or assembling the cranking motor.

step1.para: Note the alignment position of the solenoid and nose housing so the motor can be reassembled in the original configuration.
Disconnect the field coil connector from the solenoid motor terminal and the ground return lead from the solenoid, if present.

On 37-MT and 42-MT motors remove the attaching bolts and separate the commutator end cap from the field frame. 50-MT motors have brush inspection plates. Remove these plates, then remove the brush lead screws. This will disconnect the field leads from the brush holders.
On 37-MT and 42-MT motors remove attaching screws to separate brush plate assembly from the field frame.
Separate the nose housing and field frame from lever housing by removing attaching bolts.
On 37-MT and 42-MT motors remove the pinion stop.
Remove armature and clutch assembly from lever housing.
Separate solenoid from lever housing by pulling apart.
